body: Ok. I edited my original issue and added the `--print-events` log.

rename.from: Crash when writing grace accent/tick character on Rocky Linux 8
rename.to: Crash when writing acute accent/tick character on Rocky Linux 8

body:
Seems like your IME is broken. According to the protocol we should get the byte index into utf-8 string, but 1 is not a valid byte index into it. Given that it consist of 2 bytes.

 https://wayland.app/protocols/text-input-unstable-v3#zwp_text_input_v3:event:preedit_string

`1` is not the right offset for that, so your IME is broken... I guess we can filter out invalid unicode offsets and just place the cursor at the end in such cases.
This is really interesting because it might explain why my gnome terminal sometimes prints broken Unicode characters! I'll investigate further...
Upstream patch to sanity check whatever server is sending https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/2517

@cascading-jox you can also send a bug report to rocky.

The relevant fix was done https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/-/merge_requests/1132 in mutter 2 years ago.

> @cascading-jox you can also send a bug report to rocky.
> 
> The relevant fix was done https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/mutter/-/merge_requests/1132 in mutter 2 years ago.

Nice find! Rocky is supposed to be a copy of RHEL so rocky themselves won't fix this but I'll check what's going on in RHEL. And I'm amazed how quickly you wrote a PR for it @kchibisov!

issue.title: Fix crash during text compose on old GNOME
